channel.title: Batch File Error
channel.description:
I'm sad to say this but yes, i have a run.bat error. The batch file executes a jar file which opens my client.
Here is the error:
[code]Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Could not create the Java virtual machine. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
And the batch:
[code]@echo off cd Files java -Xmx1500m Gui 30 0 highmem members 32 pause[/code]

item.title: Batch File Error
item.dc:creator: @heroisgay heroisgay
item.description:
@heroisgay wrote:

Oh ok thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Batch File Error
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

Yes, the “Start Client.jar”. I suggest replacing what you have in your Start Client.bat with this.

@echo off cls title Client java -cp ./Start Client.jar -Xmx500m Gui pause

What was wrong with your code before was that it was just searching for “Gui”, the snippet I provided above finds the Gui class in the Start Client.jar.

Read full topic

Maybe this will help more :

item.title: Batch File Error
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

[quote=“heroisgay, post:7, topic:251145”][quote author=_Reforced link=topic=331411.msg2587387#msg2587387 date=1229571998]
What’s the .jar file you’re trying to execute?
[/quote]

It is for Prima’s Summon-pkz v7 client.[/quote]

That doesn’t help at all, you said in your topic that you were trying to execute a .jar file for your client, which goes into the .jar finding the main class. Thus, what’s the .jar file you’re attempting to execute?

Read full topic
